CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is currently residing in GPE . He is an officer in ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON filed a criminal complaint against the applicant , stating that in DATE the latter , in his capacity as officer , had forced CARDINAL recruits to give him money . On DATE , however , PERSON withdrew his complaint , considering that the ORG version was not credible .
CARDINAL . In an order of CARDINAL DATE , the PERSON investigating judge committed the applicant for trial , commencing on DATE before the Cosenza ORG on a charge of extortion .

CARDINAL . A number of hearings took place . They were postponed either by reason of legitimate impediment of the applicant , or because of witnesses’ absence , or finally because of lawyer ’s strikes . On DATE the CARDINAL recruits were examined . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE , PERSON and CARDINAL other witnesses were examined .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , filed with the registry on DATE , the Cosenza ORG acquitted the applicant . This decision became final on DATE .
